description:
"The Israeli Ministry of Health approved new regulation for the educational system 1. Practical training or practical studies may be held in a higher education establishment or vocational training establishment that cannot be administered by online learning due to the need for equipment or infrastructures essential for learning.

2. Up to 10% of the students in those establishments may have access to infrastructures or equipment essential for participating in online learning. 

3. Studies will be held in regular capsules, with teaching staff may alternate between up to three groups. 

4. Outdoor activities may be held with one staff member and up to 19 students, including an assistant to a student who requires assistance. It should be stressed: Said assistant is to be counted in the maximum permitted the number of participants in said activities."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Higher education institutions (i.e. degree granting institutions)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 30th of November, 2020. In Israel, The Ministerial Coronavirus Committee approved the amendment to the outline of the pilot for reopening the malls as follows: Regarding the maximum permitted capacity in the mall premises, capacity is changed from a ratio of one person per 7 square meters to a ratio of one person per 15 square meters.    Regarding the surface area of the stores themselves, it will be determined that in addition to the rule stipulated by the main regulations (according to which, capacity will be at a ratio of one person per 7 square meters and up to 10 people in total) in "large" stores whose surface area exceeds 150 square meters, maximum permitted capacity will be at a ratio of one person per 15 square meters (without setting a numerical capping on the number of patrons. Calculation of surface area for matters of maximum permitted capacity in the mall (in the common areas) will not include the surface area of a public and business establishment forbidden from operating inside a mall (such as the surface area of a movie theater inside the mall).
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 25th of December, 2020. The Ministerial Committee for Coping with the Coronavirus determined that from December 27, 2020, 17:00, to January 9, 2021, workplaces employing more than 10 workers will not be able to allow simultaneous presence of workers at a rate exceeding 50% of the workforce, or 10 employees, whichever is higher, with the following exceptions: Workplaces that provide essential services, establishments for the provision of subsistence services, establishments with a special permit to employ workers during rest hours and workplaces engaged in construction or infrastructure works, defense industry and security-supporting enterprises (to which other restrictions will apply). Beyond the aforesaid restriction, employers will be required to continue meeting the conditions of the Purple Badge.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 25th of December, 2020. The Ministerial Committee for Coping with the Coronavirus determined that from December 27, 2020, 17:00, to January 9, 2021, workplaces employing more than 10 workers will not be able to allow simultaneous presence of workers at a rate exceeding 50% of the workforce, or 10 employees, whichever is higher, with the following exceptions: Workplaces that provide essential services, establishments for the provision of subsistence services, establishments with a special permit to employ workers during rest hours and workplaces engaged in construction or infrastructure works, defense industry and security-supporting enterprises (to which other restrictions will apply). Beyond the aforesaid restriction, employers will be required to continue meeting the conditions of the Purple Badge. UPDATE: The policy was extended until the 26th of January, 2021. In addition, Employees may not enter their places of work except for places of work for which exceptions have been made including those that provide essential and vital services and those engaged in construction or infrastructure work.  All employers shall be entitled to allow employees to go to their place work if their presence is necessary for its maintenance or continued functioning.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: Some educational relaxation in Israel as of 11 Feb 2021. The opening of preschools and 1st through 4th grades in green and yellow localities. In borderline-orange localities, with an index score of 6.5 and lower, in which the vaccination rate among people 50 and older is over 70% - school activities in the same outline as in green and yellow localities. In all other localities: Educational activities will be permitted outdoors, in groups of up to 10 people (including the teacher). Borderline-orange localities will be given priority in the Magen Education program (coronavirus tests among school pupils).
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education

description:
In Israel, 21 Feb 2021:

"The 5th and 6th grades as well as 11th and 12th grades will go back to school in local authorities and areas designated as yellow and green according to the Traffic Light model, as well as in local authorities and areas designated as orange, whose index score is 7 at most and with a vaccination rate of at least 70% among those aged 50 and older.
Hebrew classes for olim will reopen.
The 13th and 14th grades in recognized technical colleges will reopen according to the same reopening model as in schools. 
Classroom learning activities will be held in technical colleges serving as a continuing education program for at-risk youth throughout Israel. 
The permitted quota for holding outdoor learning activities will be increased from 10 people per group to 20.
Youth movements and organizations will be permitted to hold outdoor activities in the same reopening model as in schools.
External operators will be permitted to enter preschools and schools.
Single-day tours will be permitted for educational programs cleared for reopening
Boarding schools will be allowed to resume pre-lockdown open program activities, in groups of up to 18 pupils, in such a way as to allow the unhindered entry and exit to and from the boarding school."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Secondary Schools (generally for children ages 10 to 18)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Ministry/Department of Health,Ministry/Department of Education

description:
On the 21st of February, 2021. The government of Israel approved the following opening restrictions apply to markets and malls, Capacity restrictions: At a ratio of one person per each 15 square meters. The operator will install a digital adjustment apparatus to count the number of people entering the mall. Mall owners are required to place between 2-5 ushers serving as coronavirus prefects, tasked with ensuring that everyone in place follows the coronavirus guidance. Mall owners are also required to take actions for preventing gatherings in the mall's premises, including at the entrance to stores and at the entrance to the mall, including taking measures to enforce the distancing policy in the waiting lines by placing visual cues on the floor and physical distancing means. Visitors may not sit down for meals in the mall's premises, there will be no dining tables and chairs in the mall's premises, access will be denied to dining tables permanently fastened to the floor, if there are any such tables. Mall owners or operators will place prominent signs reminding visitors that eating in the mall's premises is forbidden.
Food stands may not be placed in the mall's premises and fairs may not be held. Mall owners will separate, inasmuch as possible, to keep the mall's entrances and exits separate. Inasmuch as possible, mall owners will take actions to make sure that the air is circulated at least 3 times per hour.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Shopping Centers
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On the 21st of February, 2021. The government of Israel approved the opening of museums with the following measures must be adhered to: Visitors will register in advance; Ushers will be appointed; Guided tours will be held with no more than 10 people and arranged ahead of time;  Inasmuch as possible, visitors' route through the museum or the exhibit will be according to a previously charted course and in one direction;
In museums or exhibits where there are displays which encourage visitors to touch them, the museum or exhibit's operator will place an usher for every few active displays to remind visitors of the distancing requirement and the gathering restrictions and sanitize the displays frequently."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Public museums/galleries
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On the 21st of February, 2021. The government of Israel approved the opening of museums with the following measures must be adhered to: Visitors will register in advance; Ushers will be appointed; Guided tours will be held with no more than 10 people and arranged ahead of time;  Inasmuch as possible, visitors' route through the museum or the exhibit will be according to a previously charted course and in one direction;
In museums or exhibits where there are displays which encourage visitors to touch them, the museum or exhibit's operator will place an usher for every few active displays to remind visitors of the distancing requirement and the gathering restrictions and sanitize the displays frequently."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries
enforcer: National Government,Other (Please specify in the text box)

description:
On the 21st of February, 2021. The government of Israel has allowed Gyms to reopen with the following restrictions The establishment's owner or operator will ensure that a distance of no less than 2 meters is maintained between machines and patrons during both person training and group training, or that dividers are placed between machines with fewer than 2 meters between them.
The establishment's owner or operator will only admit patrons based on registration in advance, will not operate any Jacuzzis or saunas in place and will make sure that the establishment is properly cleaned and sanitized."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Other Businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
On the 21st of February, 2021. The government of Israel has allowed Hotels to open under the following restrictions: Hotels, excluding the dining room area, may be opened for recovered or vaccinated individuals, as well as for minor younger than 16 who presented negative test results to a coronavirus test taken up to 48 hours before arriving in the hotels (air crew or foreign nationals staying in Israel in their line of duty may be admitted subject to presenting test results as mentioned). Hotel admission includes admission to the common areas in the hotel (and excluding the dining room, as mentioned).
Hotel managers will be required to opt for their mode of operations, whether as a substitute residence, which excludes the use of the common areas, or as a hotel operating under the Green Pass requirements.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Paid lodgings (e.g. hotels; motels)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Schools will reopen in all green, yellow and orange-designated localities in Israel as of 11 March 2021. The Ministry of Health recommends that schools will also reopen in orange-designated localities. Establishments where 90 percent of all returning 11th and 12th grade pupils are either vaccinated or recovered will not be required to follow the capsule outline. In red-designated localities in which the entire education system is closed, establishments where 75 percent or higher of all 11th and 12th grade pupils are either vaccinated or recovered will be allowed to reopen schools for them and will be required to follow the capsule outline.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at Primary Schools (generally for children ages 10 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On the 19th of March, 2021. The government of Israel has announced It will be possible to take a prompt coronavirus test on the spot at the entrance to business operating under the Green Pass requirements, even for those who are neither vaccinated nor recovered.At this phase, this option does not revoke the right to present negative test results to a regular coronavirus test for minors who wish to be admitted to a hotel and for up to 5% of all guests who wish to be admitted to an event venue
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Keeping a distance of at least 6 feet or 1.5 meters apart at All or unspecified businesses
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Some further educational restrictions are to be lifted in Israel as of 21 March. The Times of Israel reports:  "In what will be the fourth step of rolling back the lockdown, ministers also approved lifting some restrictions from the education system, raising the number of students allowed to participate in outdoor events organized by kindergartens and schools from 20 to 50.    "Teaching staff and outside teachers who have presented their Green Pass to a school principal will no longer be limited in the number of different groups of students they can work with.    "Youth movement trips, including overnight stays, will be permitted for those aged 16 or older, on the condition that at least 90% of participants have a Green Pass.    "The pod system, which limits the number of students who study together, is to be canceled for 3rd graders who will study as a full class, as is already the case for grades 1-2. However, third graders in aftercare will not be permitted to mix with students from other classes."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks inside Preschool or childcare facilities (generally for children ages 5 and below)
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
The government of Israel has approved a motion by the Ministry of Health and Ministry of Education for an extensive reopening of educational institutions effective 18 April 2021.

No restrictions - schools, higher education system, trainings and informal education are back to normal, except for a Green Pass requirement and indoor mask wearing.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
